definition: abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

sentences.english: Uighur words and phrases also have motivated.
sentences.chinese: 維吾爾語詞也具有理據性。

sentences.english: For this problem, the noisy channel based Uyghur neutralized vowel identification model is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 提出基於噪聲信道的維吾爾語央音原音識別模型。

sentences.english: I have much interest in uyghur language and qazaq language as well.
sentences.chinese: 我對維吾爾語和哈薩克語也非常有興趣。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
